Class Arrays

    Alex Ruiz

            String[][] one,

        Verifies that the given String arrays are equal.
        Parameters:
        one - the first array.
        two - the second array.

        true if the arrays are equal, false otherwise.

      • format

        @InternalApi
public static String format(Object object)

      • format

        @Nonnull
public static String format(@Nullable
                    String[][] array)
        Formats a two-dimensional String array. For example, the array: 
         String[][] array = { { "0-0", "0-1", "0-2" }, { "1-0", "1-1", "1-2" }, { "2-0", "2-1", "2-2" },
     { "3-0", "3-1", "3-2" }, };
        will be formatted as: 
         [['0-0', '0-1', '0-2'],
  ['1-0', '1-1', '1-2'],
  ['2-0', '2-1', '2-2'],
  ['3-0', '3-1', '3-2']]
        Parameters:
        array - the array to format.
        Returns:
        the data of the given array formatted to make it easier to read.

      • copyOf

        @Nonnull
public static int[] copyOf(@Nonnull
                   int[] array)
        Creates and returns a copy of the given array.
        Parameters:
        array - the array to copy.
        Returns:
        the created copy.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the array to copy is null.
